subject: The NFL Returns
event:
The NFL is back.  Was I ready for some football?

Ah... er... not really.  The season somehow snuck up on me.  Too busy, I guess.  I only managed to watch one preseason game, hardly paid any attention at all, and suddenly the first game was upon us.

The Jets were pretty impressive, thumping the Cleveland Browns and Johnny Football.

The Giants... oh, ghod, what can I say?  That loss to the hated Cowboys was excruciating.  I can't deny that Tony Romo was brilliant on that final game-winning drive, especially in the absence of Dez Bryant... but Dallas did not win the game.  It was given to them.  First by the ref, who made an absolutely bogus pass interference call that resulted in a Cowboy touchdown.  And then by Eli Manning, who lost track of the Dallas timeouts and actually told Rashad Jennings not to score when the G-Men had the ball on the Dallas one, first and goal, with under two minutes left.  

One timeout, two timeouts, does it matter?  Jennings gets that ball in, the game is over.  A TD there makes it a 10-point game, and the Cowboys would not have had time enough to score twice.

Talk about shooting yourself in the foot.

Overall, the Giants D and the Jets O both looked better than anticipated.  

I do wonder if the G-Men can bounce back from a gut-wrenching loss like that.  One that they inflicted on themselves.

comments.article: Ever want to go to a Bills Jets (or Giants) game this year, its my treat!
comments.subject: Jets

comments.article: How nerdgasmy was it to have a guy named Brandon score for the Jets?
comments.subject: Another Bran

comments.article: Well, if Coughlin's on the hot seat again - NYG is going to the SB again!
comments.subject: Couglin on the hot seat again?

comments.article: Coughlin will get them back on track.  I believe he's a master of handling and overcoming tough situations.  But, hopefully not next week.  Admittedly, I am a Falcons fan.  Rise Up!!
comments.subject: Tom Coughlin

comments.article: If Dallas didn't win that game then the Giants didn't score those points off turnovers... They were given to them ðŸ˜ˆ
And Fitzpatrick is the jets Maester. Has a chain around his neck and all.
comments.subject: Eli made a ron stark error.

comments.article:
Are you both a Jets AND a Giants fan?!

I didn't think that was tolerated in NYC, it's like here in Kentucky being a UofL and UK fan -- simply does not compute!

But, yes, that Giants loss must have been heartbreaking for those wishing them well (I, myself, am a Bengals fan, so I'm not ashamed in experiencing a little schadenfreude at the misery of other fanbases). Jennings has since said that he was told on first and second down NOT to score -- which, if true, would make this more maddening than heartbreaking. What was Coughlin thinking?
comments.subject: Now wait just a dang minute

comments.article: I live in Cleveland and that game was embarrassing to watch. CRINGEWORTHY.
comments.subject: Cleveland Browns

comments.article: I'm also a lifelong Cleveland fan. That was quite embarrassing. I thought the team was going to be quite a bit better than that. There were some promising moments (literally, a moment or two) but overall that was as comically bad as we've come to expect from the team. :(
comments.subject: Re: Cleveland Browns

comments.article: And why would Eli Manning throw it on 3rd down!? Could of run the clock another 40 seconds if they ran it!!! Very frustrating!!!!

What do you think George?

Fitzmagic seemed to play pretty well. You think Geno gets thrown/forced back into the starting lineup when his face is feeling better? Or you think Fitzy stays in the lineup until he has a bad game, regardless of Geno's health. My guess - Geno sees the field week 5.
comments.subject: Fitz or Geno

comments.article: and why oh why did Eli not run down the clock on each snap?! Felt like every snap on the last drive happened with 10-20 seconds left on the play clock. Would have been so nice to start the season with a win against the Cowboys.
comments.subject: Where was Wun Wun?

comments.article: Eagles are going to win the Superbowl this year. Book it!
comments.subject: NFL

comments.article: Ummmm... no, don't think so.
comments.subject: Re: NFL

comments.article: George: Welcome to the NFL. The Cowboys showed your Giants how football is played.
comments.subject: How 'bout them Cowboys?

comments.article: Badly?
comments.subject: Re: How 'bout them Cowboys?

comments.article:
We beat you. The score was only close because Dallas couldn't remember that holding onto the ball was important. Take out the turnovers and the Giants get blown out. I suspect the second game will bear this out.

Still, give the Giants back Cruz and allow the O-line to work out the kinks and the Giants could make some noise.
comments.subject: Nah.

comments.article:
0-1 isn't too bad, but 0-2 starts to get tricky. Still, Eli's earned enough credibility in winning after 9-7 type seasons that they should be able to bounce back from the Dallas loss, no problem. Especially since it was on the road and the next time they have Dallas, it's in East Rutherford.

I'm trying to decide who's the biggest question mark. Does thumping the Manziel-led Browns really qualify as a convincing win? You might say the Giants keeping it close on the road was just as impressive.
Send Eli to the wall!!! Aka the raiders!

comments.upictitle: ryan, diesel, ty johnson, dirk vargas, ect.. ect..: Syd
comments.article: I would like to thank your New York Giants for letting go of James Jones. He really helped Packer nation out this past week.

As a Cowboys fan, I am of course glad we won. But it is very bittersweet because Dez Bryant had to have surgery on his foot and is out at least 3 weeks...and it's the type of injury that can linger for awhile so could be much, much longer.

At least former Cowboys running back DeMarco Murray, now on the Eagles, had a bad game with 8 attempts for 9, NINE!, yards. We can both be happy about the Eagles struggling.
comments.subject: Dez Bryant out for at least 3 weeks

comments.article: Glad it's back! Enjoy watching your teams this year.
comments.subject: Hooray football!

comments.article:
Hi George,

Jets season ticket holder here, in the luxurious Lexus club (2nd) level. We'd love to have you out for a game this season. Perhaps the Bills game? A good chance to enjoy some revenge on Rex Ryan for choosing to coach a division rival.
comments.subject: Jets game

comments.article:
I do go to the games when I am in the city during the season.

Last year I went to the Buffalo game, and Geno threw three INTs in the first quarter.

Now I am thinking I had better stay away.
comments.subject: Re: Jets game

comments.article:
Sure the Giants blundered away a victory. But at least they didn't look perfect for twenty minutes before allowing 30 straight points. I saw an Eagles fan complaining about his team on Facebook, so I posted this:
Oh, my sweet summer child. What do you know of fear? Fear is for the football season, my little lord, when the Lions lose all sixteen games and the ice wind comes howling out of Lambeau Field. Fear is for the long night, when the playoffs hides its face for years at a time, and little children are born and live and die without seeing a post season victory while the Lions grow gaunt and hungry, and the Packers move through the woods.
comments.subject: As a Lions fan...

comments.article:
I was impressed with the Giants despite the bone headed mistake at the end. Surprised at the D in particular, too bad JPP had to Davos himself or could've been even better.

As for the comment above on the Eagles, I am sorry George but Chip Kelly is a God amongst men and Tom Coughlin should not be mentioned in the same sentence as him. This is coming from a Giants fan. It's only a matter of time before the Eagles start winning super bowls. Hopefully we have one more wacky Super Bowl run in us.
I'm surprised you don't do fantasy football.
